feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KENNICOTT GLACIER DAMMED HIDDEN LAKE RELEASING... Hidden Lake, which is dammed by the Kennicott Glacier, has begun to release and may cause a significant rise on the Kennicott River at McCarthy. The Kennicott River water level prior to the release was 1342.5 ft, gage datum, on the river gage. Expect water levels on the Kennicott River to rise an additional

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: …High water on the Tanana River into the Weekend… The Tanana River is running near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. This is the result of a combination of heavy rain and recent warm weather causing significant snowmelt and glacial runoff. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to gradually fall some over the next few
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Flood Statement issued July 14 at 7:51AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 11 AM... WHAT...Minor flooding resulting from Heavy Rain. WHERE...American Samoa WHEN...Through 11 AM IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall and runoff may cause elevated stream and drainage ditch levels. Ponding may occur on roads and low lying areas.

entry.title: High Surf Warning issued July 14 at 7:11AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Warning remains in effect... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of more than 15 feet will impact west, south and east facing shores exposed to the large southerly swells and strong tradewinds. * WHERE...All Islands of American Samoa. * WHEN...through Friday.

Gusty

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:02PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact the city of Prescott across Yavapai County through 1245 PM MST... HAZARD...Winds of up to 40 mph, very heavy rainfall, and half inch hail.

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:41AM PDT until July 15 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH NIGHT THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore each night this week through late Thursday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas
